channel.title: Computational Social Neuroscience Group
channel.description: Recent content on Computational Social Neuroscience Group

item.title: About Our Lab
item.description: Welcome to the Computational Social Neuroscience Group at George Mason University. We are a multidisciplinary group with focuses in neuroscience, psychology, and programming. We employ many methods such as online research, Electroencepolgraphy, and Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging in our research. Our lab is made up of a range of diverse thinkers from our Principle Investigator, Jim Thompson, to our ever friendly and helpful Research Assistants. item.title: Contact
item.description: Principle Investigator James C. Thompson Email: jthompsz [at] gmu.edu Lab Manager Lindsay S. Shaffer Email: lshaffe6 [at] gmu.edu George Mason University David King Hall, Room 2086 4400 University Drive, 3F5 Fairfax, VA 22030

item.title: Lab Members
item.description: img { width: 156px; height: 196px; } Principle Investigator Dr. James C Thompson Dr Thompson is an Associate Professor in the Department of Psychology at GMU and is a member of the Cognitive and Behavioral Neuroscience Graduate Program. He is Scientific Director of GMU’s MRI Core Facility and a co-Deputy Director of CASBBI. Dr Thompson received his PhD in Cognitive Neuroscience from the Brain Sciences Institute at Swinburne University in Australia, followed by a postdoctoral fellowship in the Department of Radiology at West Virginia University.

item.title: Research
item.description: Description of research goes here. Current projects: • Social Discounting Isabella Lalena, Morgan DeHart Goals Interested in Participating? • Reward Devaluation Lindsay Shaffer, Jonathan Schneider, Matthew Olimb Goals Interested in Participating? • Social Reward Eslam Hassan, Matthew Olimb Goals Interested in Participating? Past projects: • Temporal Dynamics of the Neural Representation of Social Relationships Humans can rapidly encode information from faces to support social judgments and facilitate interactions with others.
